alert.note: Alert for Central and East Adams and Arapahoe Counties; Central and South Weld County; Logan County; Morgan County; Northeast Weld County; Phillips County; Sedgwick County; Washington County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued January 12 at 2:10AM MST until January 16 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...ARCTIC BLAST AND HEAVY MOUNTAIN SNOW... .Snow will increase in the mountains this afternoon and evening. The snow will combine with strong winds gusts of 50 to 75 mph above timberline to produce widespread blowing and drifting snow, poor visibility, and dangerous travel conditions. While the snow may taper off Saturday, another round of even heavier snow is expected develop Saturday night and continue through Sunday. On the plains, arctic cold will settle across the area tonight, with dangerously cold wind chill readings expected to last all the way through Tuesday morning. This will be an extended cold snap, resulting in a heightened risk of frostbite and hypothermia for people with prolonged outdoor exposure, and an increased burden on outdoor animals. ...WIND CHILL WARNING IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 11 AM MST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero. * WHERE...East central and northeast Colorado. * WHEN...From midnight tonight to 11 AM MST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: The combination of wind and cold temperatures will create dangerously low wind chill values. Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear several layers of appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Take precautions now to provide shelter for outdoor animals.
